info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 17 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ALAMANCE AND SOUTHWESTERN ORANGE COUNTIES... At 613 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of Mebane, or 10 miles southwest of Hillsborough, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Chapel Hill, Carrboro, Cane Creek Reservoir and Saxapahaw. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
